title: Harry Walker (footballer)
text:
George Henry Walker (20 May 1916 – 1976) was an English <a href="association%20football">football</a> <a href="goalkeeper%20%28football%29">goalkeeper</a> born in <a href="Aysgarth">Aysgarth</a>, <a href="North%20Yorkshire">North Yorkshire</a>, who played in <a href="the%20Football%20League">the Football League</a> for <a href="Darlington%20F.C.">Darlington</a>, <a href="Portsmouth%20F.C.">Portsmouth</a> and <a href="Nottingham%20Forest%20F.C.">Nottingham Forest</a>. He played in the Portsmouth team that beat <a href="Wolverhampton%20Wanderers%20F.C.">Wolverhampton Wanderers</a> 4–1 in the <a href="1939%20FA%20Cup%20Final">1939 FA Cup Final</a>.
Later Harry worked for a company called Pump and Valve Service, he was a skilled engineer and lived at Beeston, a suburb of Nottingham. He had a wife called Ella. He worked for Pump and Valve Service up until his death and was survived by Ella.
Honours.
Portsmouth
